instructions: On your Mac, when a notification appears in the top-right corner of the screen, do one of the following: Accept an incoming call: Click Accept. Accept a video call as an audio call: Click the down arrow next to Accept, then choose Answer as Audio. When you re in an audio call or a phone call, the camera is automatically off. Accept a video or audio call and end a current call: Click End & Accept. Accept an audio call and put the current audio call on hold: Click Hold & Accept. When you end the new call, the call on hold resumes. You can pause one audio call at a time. You can also accept a Group FaceTime call from Messages. When invited, just click Join in the FaceTime message bubble. When you re on a call, you can do any of the following. Change your view of the call Pause the call Mute or change the volume for the call Add contacts Add more callers to a Group FaceTime call
